title.narrative: SWE-2011-46 Source Determinations of Climate- and Health-Afflicting Air Particulate Matter emitted from the South Asian region
SWE-2011-46 Source Determinations of Climate- and Health-Afflicting Air Particulate Matter emitted from the South Asian region

description.narrative: Black carbon (BC) containing aerosols shading S Asia in the winter cause severe effects on both climate and the air people breathe, yet the combustions sources are poorly constrained, which hampers society to decrease emissions. The key objectives are to quantify key combustion sources and to resolve the climate effect of aerosols of different sizes and sources. The source apportionment of BC aerosols in Asia is identified by the Swedish gvmts new Strategy for Short-Lived Climate Forcers as a key national priority of relevance for global sustainable development. Aerosols from 16mo field campaigns at the key remote Climate Observatory for S Asia (on a desolate island of the Maldives, + urban ref. stn), will be probed by microscale 14C dating. Quantitative information on fossil vs biomass combustion will be used to advise EPAs and UNEP to guide policy options toward BC mitigation.
